job_description:
Evil exists and fortunately we're here to stop it! Fraud and abuse plague online businesses of all types and in various forms (i.e. payment fraud, content and promotional abuse, account takeover, chargebacks). As the internet's trust layer, Sift Science's mission is simple yet powerful: make these online experiences faster, smoother, and safer using the smartest technology around. We are looking for passionate, technically agile new grads who have the ability to dive into tough problems and are eager to take on and learn new skills.

At Sift Science, engineers build our products soup-to-nuts, or, if you prefer, bits-to-pixels. Our stack is built primarily in Java using Hadoop, HDFS, and HBase. As you can see, we love open source, but we don't shy away from building our own technology when the best available isn't good enough. As a New Grad Engineer at Sift, you will work on a variety of technical problems (front-end, back-end, data-science, full-stack) that span our entire product and internal infrastructure.

What you'll do

Some of the complex and challenging problems our engineering teams work on are:

Infrastructure - Infrastructure is the backbone of everything we do at Sift. Examples of projects include finding and removing performance bottlenecks, scaling databases, building a framework for feature extraction, and server architecture and administration.

Machine learning - We fight fraud with machine learning and our approach is unique. We train our models on millions of transactions across hundreds of customer sites, with countless features extracted from each.

Applications - The best infrastructure and machine learning techniques are meaningless without applications that put them to good use. Our API platform enables our customers to get value from Sift Science within minutes of signing up, and our front-end Console product summarizes our predictions in ways that are instantly actionable.

What makes you a good fit
Graduating in 2019 with a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or related field
Previous internship experience in software engineering
Proficiency in a dynamic programming language such as Java or Python
Proactive nature, and the ability to continually learn from your experiences
Bonus Points
Proficiency with object-oriented programming
Experience with machine learning
Experience with programming concurrent servers
Experience with distributed systems and networking
Experience with web programming and visualizations
Experience with Hadoop, HDFS, and HBase
